Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Seed holds a specific address. In Native mode all addresses and their private keys are stored in wallet.dat file

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <andju> oh fuck then.. i lost it then if thats the case

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <andju> and i have already formatted my pc so i will not be bale to recover the wallet.dat file

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can't use seed key to login into Native mode. you can only import seed key into native mode

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can try HDD data recovery if you can find that wallet.dat file. but, there is no other way to retrieve if you didn't backup wallet.dat or the private key of `RRN2a8QxC1GcKjd4SGKbLNo56pZKqdXc4N`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <andju> yes, i imported my seed key into native mode.. when i created my seed key the address was: RXZZ4m1wCn1CMk9EdWdZvwh58U7bg5VoGs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <andju> so what your saying is the seed key does not link to the new address

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
when you use native mode to send funds or claim reward, the funds goes to a new change address which is different from the address that the seed phrase generates. that is default behaviour for any coin that uses native mode including BTC
if you use the seed in Lite mode, all funds stays in same address
